segments.text: I am terrified watching the boy on that stool.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: It’s wobbling so much, and he’s going to fall any second.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The woman is standing in a puddle, and she doesn’t even notice.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I notice the water is spreading, and it’s going to be a huge mess.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The girl is just standing there, not even trying to help.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I think the boy is going to pull the whole cabinet down with him.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The cookie jar is almost empty, and he’s still reaching like it’s the last one on earth.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I see the woman’s foot in the water, and I’m just waiting for her to slip.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The whole scene is making my heart race, and I can’t look away.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I notice the garden outside is so calm, but inside, it’s pure chaos.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I think someone needs to stop this before it gets worse.
segments.speaker: PAR
